text: Felonious Gru — A once‑notorious supervillain turned family man and eventual secret agent; Gru adopts three orphan girls, becomes a loving father, and leads the Minions while repeatedly confronting new threats and rivals.
The Minions — Small, yellow, comedic henchmen who speak a playful, mixed-language gibberish; loyal to Gru and characterized by slapstick behavior and a love of bananas.
Margo — The eldest of the three girls Gru adopts; responsible and protective toward her sisters, she gradually learns to trust Gru and grows into a more independent teenager.
Edith — The middle sister, tomboyish and mischievous; enjoys pranks and later shows competence with physical activities such as martial arts.
Agnes — The youngest adopted sister, gentle and innocent with a passionate love for unicorns; her optimism often endears her to other characters and provides heart to the story.
Lucy Wilde — A quirky, gadget-savvy Anti‑Villain League agent who becomes Gru's partner and later his wife; Lucy brings humor and competence to missions and to family life.
Dr. Nefario — Gru's long-time inventor and technical partner, known for eccentric gadgets and experiments; he has a complex relationship with villainy and loyalty to Gru.
Silas Ramsbottom — Director of the Anti‑Villain League (AVL), an official who oversees villain-related threats and interacts with Gru and agents throughout the series.
Marlena Gru — Gru and Dru's mother; her relationship with Gru is emotionally significant and provides insight into his motivations and family background.
Dru — Gru's long-lost twin brother who embraces a flashy supervillain persona; Dru provides comic contrast and a family story arc when reunited with Gru.
Fritz — Dru's courteous butler who assists Dru and interacts politely with Gru and the extended cast when the family reunites at Dru's mansion.
Felonious Gru Jr. — The infant son of Gru and Lucy introduced in the later films; serves as a new family member who shifts Gru's responsibilities and emotional stakes.
Poppy Prescott — An aspiring (and later introduced) supervillain with admiration for Gru's work; Poppy appears in later entries in the franchise.
Kyle — A pet-like monster who initially behaves viciously but warms to Gru's family, especially Agnes; he provides moments of comic conflict and eventual affection.
Lucky — A small one-horned goat Agnes mistakes for a unicorn; Lucky becomes a cherished pet and a gentle subplot in the series.
Wild Knuckles — A retired villain who mentors Gru in later entries; his arc shows how former villains can be complex, sometimes helpful characters.
Master Chow — A former kung-fu teacher who appears in the prequel entries, representing unexpected cameos that connect to Gru's early life and training.
